SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am24.network.rmi

Class RMIClient

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am24.network.rmi.RMIClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientActions
public class RMIClient extends Object implements ClientActions
The RMIClient class represents a client that interacts with a remote server using RMI (Remote Method Invocation). It implements the ClientActions interface and manages game-related actions and communications.

    • createGame

      public void createGame(String nickname, int numPlayers) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException
      Creates a new game lobby with the specified nickname and number of players.
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface ClientActions
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player creating the game.
      numPlayers - The number of players in the game.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication issue occurs.
      NotBoundException - if the server is not bound.

    • chooseInitialCardSide

      public void chooseInitialCardSide(String nickname, int choice) throws RemoteException
      Allows the player to choose the initial side of a card in the game.
      Specified by:
      chooseInitialCardSide in interface ClientActions
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player choosing the card side.
      choice - The choice indicating the initial side of the card (0 for front, 1 for back).

      RemoteException - if a remote communication issue occurs.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(String nickname, int cardIndex, boolean isFront, int x, int y) throws RemoteException
      Allows the player to play a card on the game board.
      Specified by:
      playCard in interface ClientActions
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player playing the card.
      cardIndex - The index of the card being played.
      isFront - true if the front side of the card is being played, false for the back side.
      x - The x-coordinate on the game board where the card is being played.
      y - The y-coordinate on the game board where the card is being played.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication issue occurs.
